Class AbstractXClock<F extends XTime.Phase<F>>

java.lang.Object
  com.xtructure.xsim.impl.AbstractXClock<F>
Type Parameters:
F - the type of phase of the time of this clock

Direct Known Subclasses:
StandardXClock
public abstract class AbstractXClock<F extends XTime.Phase<F>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements XClock<F>

A base class for XClock implementations.

Version:
0.9.6
Author:
Peter Nürnberg

Method Detail

getTime

public final XTime<F> getTime()
Returns the current time.

Specified by:
getTime in interface XClock<F extends XTime.Phase<F>>
Returns:
the current time

increment

public final XTime<F> increment()
Increments the time and returns the new value.

Incrementing the time will cause the time to advance to the next clock phase if possible. If the current time phase is the last available time phase, the tick will be incremented, and the phase will be reset to the first available time phase.

Specified by:
increment in interface XClock<F extends XTime.Phase<F>>
Returns:
the newly incremented time

setTime

public void setTime(XTime<F> time)
Sets the current time.

Implementations may refuse to allow certain time manipulations, such as setting times with negative tick values, moving backwards in time, etc. In these cases, this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

Specified by:
setTime in interface XClock<F extends XTime.Phase<F>>
Parameters:
time - the time to which to set this clock
